meanings.definition: To set a limit or boundary before something else
meanings.sent1: She decided to prelimit the number of guests at the party to avoid overcrowding.
meanings.sent2: It is important to prelimit the time spent on social media to maintain productivity.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's attempt to prelimit the students' excitement about the upcoming field trip backfired when they became even more enthusiastic.
meanings.sent4: By prelimiting the amount of sugar in her diet, she was able to maintain a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: He prelimited his expenses for the month to ensure he stayed within his budget.

meanings.definition: A limit set before something else
meanings.sent1: The prelimit on the number of attendees for the event was strictly enforced.
meanings.sent2: The prelimit for submissions to the contest was clearly stated in the guidelines.
meanings.sent3: The prelimit on dessert servings caused disappointment among the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The prelimit on available parking spaces led to chaos in the crowded city.
meanings.sent5: Knowing the prelimit on characters for the essay helped the students plan their writing effectively.
